issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Testing Infrastructure
components.description: Tracks issues with tests and testing infrastructure.

comments.body:
The issue is that as part of HIVE-11489, I am cleaning the generated 'TestSparkCliDriver' before running the test.  Turns out multiple tests can be running on the same machine, so this is not so good.

I tuned the PTest server to run the drivers not in parallel, going to give a try.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12770487/HIVE-12229.3-spark.patch

{color:red}ERROR:{color} -1 due to no test(s) being added or modified.

{color:red}ERROR:{color} -1 due to 3 failed/errored test(s), 9650 tests executed
*Failed tests:*
{noformat}
org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli.TestMiniLlapCliDriver.initializationError
org.apache.hadoop.hive.hwi.TestHWISessionManager.testHiveDriver
org.apache.hive.jdbc.TestSSL.testSSLVersion
{noformat}

Test results: http://ec2-174-129-184-35.compute-1.amazonaws.com/jenkins/job/PreCommit-HIVE-SPARK-Build/990/testReport
Console output: http://ec2-174-129-184-35.compute-1.amazonaws.com/jenkins/job/PreCommit-HIVE-SPARK-Build/990/console
Test logs: http://ec2-50-18-27-0.us-west-1.compute.amazonaws.com/logs/PreCommit-HIVE-SPARK-Build-990/

{noformat}
Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.TestCheckPhase
Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.PrepPhase
Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.ExecutionPhase
Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.ReportingPhase
Tests exited with: TestsFailedException: 3 tests failed
{noformat}

This message is automatically generated.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12770487 - PreCommit-HIVE-SPARK-Build

Sergio mentioned he might be interested.

A long-term fix needs to be done for this.  Right now, I am just setting qFileTests.xxx.isolateDriver= true for all the drivers as a workaround on the server.

Potential ideas:
1.  clean only the testdriver class files and not the java file (to force recompilation, but not remove the testdriver java file and make other test processes have no test to run).
2.  disable parallelism in code for all generated testdriver files
3.  rework the generated testdriver file such that they read an environment variable (probably the cleanest, needs investigation) instead of hardcode the path

I did more research about a solution for this. I will move with #3 where we have to rework in the generated testdriver file. My plan is to not use the QFileNames.txt file anymore. I will make some changes, and upload a patch for the test.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12771135/HIVE-12330.4-spark.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12771580 - PreCommit-HIVE-SPARK-Build
[~xuefuz] Do you know if the MiniLlap driver is failing in you side? It is failing on mine, but I don't know why it did not fail on Jenkins before.

Yes, it's also failing on my local box too, but it passes in master. I guess this could be due to the fact that spark branch doesn't have all changes in the master. I can do another merge to resolve the issue. In the meantime, if those are the only failures, I think you patch is good.
Agree, +1, thanks for working on this Sergio!

I need to fix 2 more drivers {{TestHBaseCliDriver.vm}} and {{TestHBaseNegativeCliDriver.vm}}. I left those at the end because they need special initialization, and I did want to do a quick test about the current changes on this patch. 

[~xuefuz] [~szehon] If you think this patch is enough, then I can commit it.
OK go ahead and fix those.  Thanks

ATTACHMENT ID: 12771990 - PreCommit-HIVE-SPARK-Build
[~xuefuz] [~szehon] This is the final patch. The tests do not look related to the changes, are you ok with doing the commit?

[~spena], thanks for working on this. I'll leave the code review to Szehon, but I have two questions: 1. To confirm, these changes are applicable to master, right? That will happen the next time we merge spark branch to master. 2. Test run #998, which ran against latest spark branch w/ a dummy patch, seems having less failures than this one. I'd just to make sure that the env is indeed okay. Could you double check? We can reattach the patch to have another run.

They're applicable to master.
I'll re-attach the patch to see the tests.
Thanks Sergio for the fix, +1 pending tests.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12772029 - PreCommit-HIVE-SPARK-Build

The errors are because output differences. 
The patch did not touch any of the output. Not sure why it is still failing here.
Yeah. It's a little unpredictable as well. Let's commit this and investigate those failures in a separate JIRA. Thanks.

Thanks guys. I committed this to spark
[~xuefuz] What is the fix version for this in the spark branch?
spark-branch
